glsa.title: Courier Authentication Library: SQL injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: An SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered in the Courier Authentication Library.

background.p: The Courier Authentication Library is a generic authentication API that encapsulates the process of validating account passwords.

description.p: It has been discovered that some input (e.g. the username) passed to the library are not properly sanitised before being used in SQL queries.

impact.p: A remote attacker could provide specially crafted input to the library, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary SQL commands. NOTE: Exploitation of this vulnerability requires that a MySQL database is used for authentication and that a Non-Latin character set is selected.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
